intro: Horkelia fusca var. typica, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Horkelia fusca var. typica is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and cotton.
